text: The Moroccan–American Treaty of Friendship was a treaty between Morocco and the United States. It was signed in 1786.Roberts, Priscilla H. and Richard S. Roberts, Thomas Barclay (1728-1793): Consul in France, Diplomat in Barbary. Lehigh University Press. 2008, pp.158-223. . By signing it, King Mohammed III began diplomatic relations with the newly independent United States. == References == == Other websites == *English text of the treaty from Yale University's Lillian Goldman Law Library Category:History of Morocco Category:1786 in the United States Category:Treaties of the United States Category:1780s treaties
title: Moroccan–American Treaty of Friendship
